discourse_list.title: Data Ring Topic: Provider Infrastructure / Running Nodes

content.content: The ecosystem should begin moving away from relying on centralized node/data providers. Potential areas for discussion:  Forking client code to add indexing / digesting services EIPs specific to improving usability from the nodes Better documenting existing RPC interfaces Improving cross-client consistency (i.e. Parity traces vs. Geth traces) Modular / plugable clients. dAppNode  Action item: @Patrick will start a thread about what is required for devs to run nodes. Action Item: @tjayrush  will write a Medium post and start an EIP related to building indices. Please provide links or comments to any of the above.
Super-excited about this one, as you know! I would add business models / incentives /  “sustainability”.

This is a great topic. We have earlier written about cross client consistency  https://medium.com/tokenanalyst/weird-quirks-we-found-in-ethereum-nodes-d5dcbad0c86 https://medium.com/tokenanalyst/towards-production-grade-open-source-ethereum-nodes-6ef2e9458fb4  Would be willing to contribute in any way possible.

Hi! Some of the work Im working on might be useful for this topic. For the past months I have been working on a modular Ethereum client in Go (https://github.com/umbracle/minimal). The main goal is to increase the use cases for the client by building it with plug and play components. For example, a discovery protocol to build clusters of nodes or an bandwidth-limited syncer protocol for contrained devices. Besides, I am also working on another project that might be of interest for the data ring. Heura (https://github.com/umbracle/heura) is a Domain-Specific Language (DSL) to interact with Ethereum smart contracts. With a couple of lines is possible to call smart contract functions or listen for events on specific topics. It is intended to make it extensible with plugins (e.g. send email alert messages for specific events or dump an ETL operation into a JSON file). Heura could be used to build indexes and digesting services for Dapps on top of Minimal. I hope I can be of any help.
